questions.question: The HTTP protocol is used for transferring web pages.
TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol.
The default port for HTTPS is 21.
A router operates at the Network Layer of the OSI model.
An IP address is a unique identifier assigned to each device on a network.
FTP stands for File Transfer Protocol.
The maximum length of a CAT5 Ethernet cable is 100 meters.
DNS translates domain names to IP addresses.
The default port for FTP is 80.
IPv6 addresses are 128 bits long.
SMTP is used for sending emails.
MAC addresses are used at the Data Link Layer.
A switch is a Layer 3 device.
ICMP is used for network diagnostics.
The loopback IP address is 127.0.0.1.
The default subnet mask for a Class C network is 255.0.0.0.
POP3 is used to retrieve emails from a server.
An SSID is used to identify a Wi-Fi network.
The OSI model has 7 layers.
ARP stands for Address Resolution Protocol.
